newsitem.title: USA: Motorola invests equity stake in WorldGate.
newsitem.headline: Motorola invests equity stake in WorldGate.

text.p: Motorola Inc said Tuesday it has invested in an equity stake in WorldGate Communications, developer of an interactive TV Internet access service.
Terms of the transaction were not disclosed.

At a basic monthly fee of $4.95, WorldGate service offers to the the cable industry an interactive Internet service which uses an analog cable converter, an existing TV set and a remote control (patents applied for). No personal computer or other set-top box is required.

In addition, WorldGate has developed Channel Hyperlinking, the ability for subscribers -- with a single key stroke -- to connect directly to a Web site associated with a TV show or commercial announcement. Logging on to this service, for e-mail, Web browsing, or Channel Hyperlinking, requires less than three seconds. The WorldGate service will begin operating in the first quarter of 1997, Motorola said .

"Motorola's investment in WorldGate reinforces our partnership with the cable industry. Motorola is committed to bring cutting edge technology solutions to cable operators," said Jim Phillips, Motorola corporate vice president, in a statement.
